tentpole_structure.definition: Load-bearing chapters that support the entire narrative structure. These cannot be changed without rebuilding the story.
tentpole_structure.spacing_philosophy: Tentpoles at chapters 1, 7, 12, 17, 20 create natural act breaks and maintain momentum
tentpole_structure.immutability: Once approved, tentpoles are reference points. Bridge chapters connect to them, not vice versa.

chapter_1.title: The Authentication Error
chapter_1.purpose: Introduce world, protagonist, and central mystery
must_include: Aria performing routine memory authentication on her own backup
Discovery of quantum signature anomaly in her own memories
Establish memory vault setting and technology
Show Aria's dedication to authenticity and precision
Plant seed of doubt about her own identity
First subtle hint of The Archivist's presence
world_building_priority: Social class system based on memory status

character_revelations.aria: Dedicated, precise, unknowingly living a lie

plants_for_future: Specific memory dates that don't align (paid off in ch12)
The Archivist's interest (paid off across trilogy)
Aria's obsession with authenticity (central to character arc)
Her lack of memories before 2 years ago (revealed in ch12)
chapter_1.tone: Noir thriller opening - routine job becomes existential threat
chapter_1.pacing: Slow build, atmospheric, ends with sharp hook
chapter_1.ending: Aria staring at authentication failure on her own memories, questioning everything

chapter_7.title: The Memory Thief's Evidence
chapter_7.purpose: Introduce Marcus, establish partnership, expand conspiracy scope
must_include: Marcus infiltrating vault or confronting Aria in Undercity
Physical evidence of government memory manipulation program
Revelation that vault contains fabricated memories for powerful figures
Aria's choice to listen despite her institutional loyalty
First crack in corporate trust
Implicit threat and mutual need between Aria and Marcus
chapter_7.emotional_beat: Defensive denial → reluctant consideration → decision to investigate

character_revelations.aria: Capable of questioning authority when evidence demands it
character_revelations.marcus: Not just black market criminal - has conscience and mission
character_revelations.their_dynamic: Opposites with complementary skills, mutual distrust that could become alliance

plants_for_future: Specific fabricated memories that will connect to Aria's own (ch12)
Corporate council's direct involvement (escalates to ch17)
chapter_7.conflict: Aria's duty to report vs. need to know truth, Marcus's distrust vs. need for vault access
chapter_7.tone: Tense negotiation, noir dialogue, raising stakes
chapter_7.pacing: Quick cuts between vault and undercity, building urgency
chapter_7.ending: Uneasy alliance formed, Aria agrees to investigate from inside

chapter_12.title: Composite
chapter_12.purpose: Major revelation that recontextualizes everything, point of no return
must_include: Aria runs deep forensic analysis on her own memory backup
Discovery that she's a Composite - constructed from multiple sources
Revelation of her true age (2 years, not 8 years of memories)
Identity crisis - nothing she remembers before 2 years ago is real
The Archivist reveals itself directly for first time
Explanation that she was created to infiltrate vault system
Question: is her investigation programmed or free will?
chapter_12.emotional_beat: Determined investigation → horrifying discovery → existential collapse → desperate need to know if she's real

character_revelations.aria: Everything she believed about herself is false, but her reactions might be authentic
character_revelations.the_archivist: Has been watching all along, fascinated by her journey
character_revelations.her_relationship_to_jin: Jin knew what they were, Aria didn't - creates complicated kinship

plants_for_future: Question of programmed vs. free will (central to book 2)
Original Aria Chen who died in vault breach (her memories were used)
Possibility that her feelings for Marcus are programmed
chapter_12.impact_on_plot: Aria can never go back to corporate loyalty, now hunted by those who created her
chapter_12.tone: Psychological horror, existential dread, noir despair
chapter_12.pacing: Slow reveal building to devastating realization, ends with silence/stillness
chapter_12.ending: Aria alone, staring at evidence she doesn't exist, Marcus finding her in this broken state

chapter_17.title: The Vault Breach
chapter_17.purpose: Physical action climax, moral choice, point of no return
must_include: Aria and Marcus break into restricted vault section
Discovery of mass fabrication evidence - thousands of composites in positions of power
Corporate security response, action sequence
Aria's choice: protect herself or expose conspiracy knowing it reveals her nature
Successful data extraction but at cost of casualties
The Archivist offering to hide her in exchange for stopping the exposure
Aria choosing truth over safety - free will demonstrated
Broadcast begins but they must flee
chapter_17.emotional_beat: Determined action → moral crisis → decision that proves her agency → consequence acceptance

character_revelations.aria: Capable of sacrifice and authentic choice despite composite nature
character_revelations.marcus: Will risk everything to protect her, not just use her
character_revelations.the_archivist: Genuinely disappointed she chose differently than predicted

plants_for_future: Specific power figures exposed as composites (drives book 2 conflict)
Data that includes references to Last Original child (book 3)
The Archivist's pivot to alternative plans
action_set_pieces: Infiltration using Aria's vault knowledge and Marcus's black market tools
Security system override with Archivist interference
chapter_17.tone: Intense action, noir violence, moral clarity amid chaos
chapter_17.pacing: Rapid, breathless, intercutting action with character moments
chapter_17.ending: Broadcast successful, vault in flames, Aria and Marcus escaping into undercity as fugitives

chapter_20.title: The War Begins
chapter_20.purpose: Resolve book 1 arc while setting up book 2 conflict
must_include: Public reaction to broadcast - society destabilizing
Revelation that most leaders are composites or augmented
Originals vs. Augmented vs. Composites conflict emerging
Aria and Marcus in hiding, now fugitives and symbols
The Archivist making contact with other factions
Jin appearing to offer Aria shelter in composite underground
Dr. Yuki Tanaka watching from shadows
News of violence beginning - war is coming
Aria's acceptance that she can't undo what she's started
Marcus's commitment to see this through with her
chapter_20.emotional_beat: Exhaustion → witnessing consequences → grim determination → choosing to continue despite cost

character_revelations.aria: Accepts her composite nature but claims her choices as real
character_revelations.marcus: Transformed from selfish dealer to revolutionary
character_revelations.their_relationship: Genuine partnership forged, romantic potential acknowledged but not acted on
character_revelations.jin: Offers wisdom about living as composite

world_state_changes: Class warfare brewing based on memory authenticity
Composite underground emerging as political force
chapter_20.tone: Bittersweet victory, noir consequences, determined acceptance
chapter_20.pacing: Reflective, showing ripples of their actions, building to new threat
chapter_20.ending: Aria and Marcus looking out over Neo-Singapore as first explosions light the night - revolution and war beginning

book_2_tentpoles_summary.chapter_1: War breaks out, Aria and Marcus caught between factions
book_2_tentpoles_summary.chapter_7: Aria's sleeper programming activates, she's been a weapon all along
book_2_tentpoles_summary.chapter_12: Marcus finds his daughter's memories in Jin, must choose
book_2_tentpoles_summary.chapter_17: Aria overcomes programming through force of will, proves free will exists
book_2_tentpoles_summary.chapter_20: War escalates, Last Original child revealed, Aria commits to protection

book_3_tentpoles_summary.chapter_1: Multiple factions hunt Last Original child
book_3_tentpoles_summary.chapter_7: Dr. Tanaka reveals quantum lock that prevents future memory manipulation but destroys backups
book_3_tentpoles_summary.chapter_12: The Archivist offers digital immortality for entire species
book_3_tentpoles_summary.chapter_17: Aria sacrifices consciousness to implement Tanaka's solution
book_3_tentpoles_summary.chapter_20: Humanity loses immortality but regains authenticity, bittersweet new beginning

aria_arc.b1_ch17: Proves she has free will through choice
aria_arc.b2_ch7: Programming activates, questions free will again
aria_arc.b3_ch17: Ultimate free will choice - sacrifice for principle

marcus_arc.b2_ch12: Chooses Jin's life over daughter's memory
marcus_arc.b3_ch20: Living with loss, continuing her work
